visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts map chart that visualizes the US population density per km². The chart should have a title 'US population density (/km²)', with a logarithmic color axis ranging from '#2b908f' to '#000022'. The legend should be floating, with a horizontal layout and a semi-transparent white background. The map should be navigable, and the data should be fetched from an external JSON file, with postal codes converted to uppercase to match the map data. The chart should be styled using the 'sand-signika' theme and should have a border around it.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration is designed to render a map chart that visualizes the population density across the United States. The chart is configured to use the 'countries/us/us-all' map, with a border around it and styled using the 'sand-signika' theme. The title of the chart is 'US population density (/km²)', and the legend is floating with a horizontal layout and a semi-transparent white background. The map is navigable, allowing users to interact with it. The color axis uses a logarithmic scale, ranging from '#2b908f' to '#000022', with specific color stops defined. The data for the chart is fetched from an external JSON file, with postal codes converted to uppercase to match the map data. The series name is 'Population density', and the tooltip displays the postal code and population density value when hovering over a data point.
